On Bhutan’s Paro Chhu River, backed by the foothills of the Himalaya Mountains, the new Le Méridien Paro, Riverfront, resort opens Thursday. Done in Bhutanese décor, the 59-room hotel features a specialty Asian restaurant, European-inspired cocktail bar, indoor swimming pool and a spa. Its lobby, known as the Hub, channels the brand’s Parisian roots in music and in treats such as éclairs. Less than two miles from the country’s only airport, the resort offers convenient access to many area attractions including Taktsang, the cliffside Buddhist monastery better known as Tiger’s Nest, which is within 30 minutes’ drive, and its sibling in the capital Le Méridien Thimphu, about an hour away. Rooms from $270, including breakfast.
